articles.headline: Stocks Plunge, as Fresh Tensions With China Batter Tech Shares
articles.snippet: A slide in technology shares dragged down major stock indexes on Wall Street as investors continued to digest rising interest rates.
articles.abstract: A slide in technology shares dragged down major stock indexes on Wall Street as investors continued to digest rising interest rates.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stocks suffered their steepest drop in eight months on Wednesday, as rising interest rates gnawed at investors and as previously high-flying technology shares tumbled in the face of growing tensions with China.

articles.headline: Chinese Officer Is Extradited to U.S. to Face Charges of Economic Espionage
articles.snippet: The Chinese intelligence official was arrested in Belgium and brought to the United States, an escalation of the Trump administration’s effort to crack down on Chinese spying.
articles.abstract: The Chinese intelligence official was arrested in Belgium and brought to the United States, an escalation of the Trump administration’s effort to crack down on Chinese spying.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A Chinese intelligence official was arrested in Belgium and extradited to the United States to face espionage charges, Justice Department officials said on Wednesday, a major escalation of the Trump administration’s effort to crack down on Chinese spying.

articles.headline: Hurricane Michael Leaves Trail of Destruction as It Slams Florida’s Panhandle
articles.snippet: Residents and emergency workers spent most of the day hunkered down, only emerging after nightfall to begin assessing the Category 4 storm’s toll.
articles.abstract: Residents and emergency workers spent most of the day hunkered down, only emerging after nightfall to begin assessing the Category 4 storm’s toll.
articles.lead_paragraph: PANAMA CITY, Fla. — Hurricane Michael, one of the most powerful storms ever to hit the continental United States, slammed into the Florida Panhandle on Wednesday, unleashing a trail of destruction across 200 miles that splintered houses, peeled off roofs and stirred up a terrifying surge of seawater that submerged entire neighborhoods and sent boats careening down city streets.
articles.byline: By Richard Fausset, Alan Blinder and Patricia Mazzei

articles.headline: Former Top F.B.I. Lawyer Says Rosenstein Was Serious About Taping Trump
articles.snippet: Congressional testimony by James A. Baker, then the bureau’s general counsel, shows that F.B.I. leaders weighed the ramifications of Rod J. Rosenstein’s suggestion before rejecting it.
articles.abstract: Congressional testimony by James A. Baker, then the bureau’s general counsel, shows that F.B.I. leaders weighed the ramifications of Rod J. Rosenstein’s suggestion before rejecting it.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The F.B.I.’s former top lawyer told congressional officials in private testimony last week that he had taken seriously a suggestion by the deputy attorney general, Rod J. Rosenstein, to secretly tape conversations with President Trump but viewed it as too risky and unlikely to deliver meaningful information.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Fandos and Adam Goldman

articles.headline: Khashoggi’s Disappearance Puts Kushner’s Bet on Saudi Crown Prince at Risk
articles.snippet: More than anyone in the Trump administration, Jared Kushner cultivated Saudi Arabia’s crown prince, Mohammed bin Salman, whose family may have played a role in Jamal Khashoggi’s fate.
articles.abstract: More than anyone in the Trump administration, Jared Kushner cultivated Saudi Arabia’s crown prince, Mohammed bin Salman, whose family may have played a role in Jamal Khashoggi’s fate.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For President Trump, who has made Saudi Arabia the fulcrum of his Middle East policy, the possible murder of a Saudi journalist in Turkey is a looming diplomatic crisis. For Mr. Trump’s son-in-law, Jared Kushner, it is a personal reckoning.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler, Edward Wong and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Wall St. Extends Drop Into Sixth Day, Setting Stage for Another Awful October
articles.snippet: American stock markets briefly stabilized early Thursday, as a report showing muted inflation helped send bond yields lower. By late morning, stocks were falling again.
articles.abstract: American stock markets briefly stabilized early Thursday, as a report showing muted inflation helped send bond yields lower. By late morning, stocks were falling again.
articles.lead_paragraph: October is living up to its ominous reputation among stock investors.
articles.byline: By Matt Phillips, Alexandra Stevenson and Jack Ewing

articles.headline: Interest Rates Are Rising for All the Right Reasons
articles.snippet: Here’s what the bond market is really telling us about the economic future.
articles.abstract: Here’s what the bond market is really telling us about the economic future.
articles.lead_paragraph: The cost to borrow money is on the rise. That is bad news for home buyers and other prospective borrowers. It helped cause a stock market sell-off on Wednesday and Thursday, and prompted President Trump to say that the Federal Reserve has “gone crazy.”
